SCI1_W34.question_text: Overall, do you think science has made life easier or more difficult for most people?

SCI2A_W34.question_text: Do you think science has had a mostly positive or mostly negative effect on the quality of food in the U.S.?

SCI2B_W34.question_text: Do you think science has had a mostly positive or mostly negative effect on the quality of Health care in the U.S.?

SCI2C_W34.question_text: Do you think science has had a mostly positive or mostly negative effect on the quality of the environment in the U.S.?

MC_options: Government investments usually pay off in the long run
SCI3A_W34.question_text: In your opinion, do you think government investments in basic scientific research usually pay off in the long run, or are they not worth it?

MC_options: Government investments usually pay off in the long run
SCI3B_W34.question_text: In your opinion, do you think government investments in engineering and technology usually pay off in the long run, or are they not worth it?

MC_options: Government investment in research is essential for scientific progress
Private investment will ensure that enough scientific progress is made

FUD32_W34.question_text: Genetically modified foods come from a technique that adds genes from other organisms to change that food's genetic characteristics. How much, if anything, have you heard or read about foods with genetically modified ingredients?

MC_options: Better for your health than foods with no genetically modified ingredients
Worse for your health than foods with no genetically modified ingredients
Neither better nor worse for your health than foods with no genetically modified ingredients

MC_options: Medical treatments these days are worth the costs because they allow people to live longer and better quality lives
Medical treatments these days often create as many problems as they solve
MED1_W34.question_text: Thinking now about medicine which of these statements comes closer to your point of view, even if neither is exactly right?

MED2A_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? Healthcare providers are too quick to order tests and procedures that may not be necessary

MED2B_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? People rely too much on prescription medicines that may not be necessary

MED2C_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? New treatments are made available before we fully understand how they affect people's health

MED2D_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? The cost of treatments makes quality medical care unaffordable

MED2E_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? New treatments are so complex that patients cannot make informed decisions

MED2F_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? Side effects from prescription medicines create as many problems as the medicines solve

MED2G_W34.question_text: Thinking about medical treatments these days, how much of a problem, if at all, are the following? The process for evaluating the safety and effectiveness of new medical treatments is too slow

MED3_W34.question_text: How much, if anything, have you heard or read about gene editing that can be used to change a baby's genetic characteristics?

MC_options: An appropriate use of medical technology
MED4A_W34.question_text: Do you think changing a baby's genetic characteristics to make the baby more intelligent is an appropriate use of medical technology ?

MC_options: An appropriate use of medical technology
MED4B_W34.question_text: Do you think changing a baby's genetic characteristics to treat a serious disease or condition the baby would have at birth is an appropriate use of medical technology ?

MC_options: An appropriate use of medical technology
MED4C_W34.question_text: Do you think changing a baby's genetic characteristics to reduce the risk of a serious disease or condition that could occur over the course of his or her lifetime is an appropriate use of medical technology ?

MED5_W34.question_text: Thinking about what you have heard or read, how well do you think medical researchers understand the health risks and benefits of changing a baby's genetic characteristics?

MED6A_W34.question_text: How likely is the following if gene editing to change a baby's genetic characteristics becomes widely available? Even if gene editing is used appropriately in some cases, others will use these techniques in ways that are morally unacceptable

MED6B_W34.question_text: How likely is the following if gene editing to change a baby's genetic characteristics becomes widely available? These techniques will help people live longer and better quality lives

MED6C_W34.question_text: How likely is the following if gene editing to change a baby's genetic characteristics becomes widely available? We will use these techniques before we fully understand how they affect people's health

MED6D_W34.question_text: How likely is the following if gene editing to change a baby's genetic characteristics becomes widely available? Inequality will increase because this option will be available only for the wealthy

MED6E_W34.question_text: How likely is the following if gene editing to change a baby's genetic characteristics becomes widely available? Development of these techniques will pave the way for new medical advances that benefit society as a whole

MC_options: An appropriate use of medical technology
